intro: Hieracium parryi, commonly known as Parry's hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium parryi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
